result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Corey Niko Broady

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Corey Niko Broady appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gordon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. Attorney Copeland has been appointed. Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Corey Niko Broady appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed an Attorney.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status of counsel in Branch PE.
Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant's Request for Substitution of Judge.  (Corey N. Broady, Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility, 1015 N 10th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Court ordered no contact with IWE; DKE
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Corey Niko Broady appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont appeared by video for Corey Niko Broady.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10. Defense motion to dismiss complaint for lack of attached documents. Argued. Court DENIED. Defense motion to dismiss count 1 mandatory minimum enhancer. Argued. Court GRANTED. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Case is adjourned to Br. PE for Branch 10. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Initial appearance scheduled for this date 8/30/2022. Defendant is in custody at  MSDF. Needs to be produced for court.  Julie S has been notified via email.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/30/22 @ 2:30p
